headline.main: NAZIS SAY CHURCHILL IS COOL TO SOVIET AID; Hold He Admits Help Is Futile -- Deny Atlantic Is Safer

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Oct. 1 -- Prime Minister Winston Churchill's statement to the House of Commons evoked a note of commiseration in German quarters today and the speech was dismissed on the ground that the Prime Minister once again "felt the urge to speak" at a moment when the drift of military events and restive home sentiment called for a display of specious optimism.
